verses.kjv: Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the house of the rolls, where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.
verses.ct: King Darius then issued an order, and a search was conducted in the archives where records were stored in Babylon.

verses.kjv: And there was found at Achmetha, in the palace that is in the province of the Medes, a roll, and therein was a record thus written:
verses.ct: A scroll was discovered at Achmetha, in the royal fortress in the province of the Medes, and this is what was written in it:

verses.kjv: In the first year of Cyrus the king the same Cyrus the king made a decree concerning the house of God at Jerusalem, Let the house be builded, the place where they offered sacrifices, and let the foundations thereof be strongly laid; the height thereof threescore cubits, and the breadth thereof threescore cubits;
verses.ct: "During the 1st year of King Cyrus, King Cyrus issued a decree regarding the house of God in Jerusalem: The temple is to be rebuilt as a place where sacrifices are offered, and its foundations are to be firmly established. It should be 90 feet high and 90 feet wide,

verses.kjv: With three rows of great stones, and a row of new timber: and let the expenses be given out of the king’s house:
verses.ct: with 3 rows of large stones and one row of new timber. The costs are to be paid from the royal treasury.

verses.kjv: And also let the golden and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem, and brought unto Babylon, be restored, and brought again unto the temple which is at Jerusalem, every one to his place, and place them in the house of God.
verses.ct: Also, the gold and silver articles from the house of God that Nebuchadnezzar removed from the temple in Jerusalem and carried off to Babylon must be returned and brought back to the temple in Jerusalem, each item placed where it belongs in the house of God."

verses.kjv: Now therefore, Tatnai, governor beyond the river, Shetharboznai, and your companions the Apharsachites, which are beyond the river, be ye far from thence:
verses.ct: "So then, Tatnai, governor of the region west of the Euphrates, and Shetharboznai, along with your associates the Apharsachites who live in that region — stay away from there.

verses.kjv: Let the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in his place.
verses.ct: Do not interfere with the construction of this house of God. Let the governor of the Jewish people and their elders rebuild this house of God on its original site.

verses.kjv: Moreover I make a decree what ye shall do to the elders of these Jews for the building of this house of God: that of the king’s goods, even of the tribute beyond the river, forthwith expenses be given unto these men, that they be not hindered.
verses.ct: Furthermore, I am issuing a decree about what you must do for the Jewish elders as they build this house of God: their full expenses are to be paid immediately from the royal revenue — specifically from the taxes collected in the region west of the Euphrates — so that the work is not interrupted.

verses.kjv: And that which they have need of, both young bullocks, and rams, and lambs, for the burnt offerings of the God of heaven, wheat, salt, wine, and oil, according to the appointment of the priests which are at Jerusalem, let it be given them day by day without fail:
verses.ct: Whatever they need — young bulls, rams, and lambs for burnt offerings to the God of heaven, along with wheat, salt, wine, and oil — must be provided to them daily without exception, as the priests in Jerusalem specify.

verses.kjv: That they may offer sacrifices of sweet savours unto the God of heaven, and pray for the life of the king, and of his sons.
verses.ct: This way they can offer pleasing sacrifices to the God of heaven and pray for the well-being of the king and his sons.

verses.kjv: Also I have made a decree, that whosoever shall alter this word, let timber be pulled down from his house, and being set up, let him be hanged thereon; and let his house be made a dunghill for this.
verses.ct: I also decree that if anyone changes this order, a beam is to be torn from that person's house and they are to be impaled on it, and their house is to be turned into a pile of rubble because of this.

verses.kjv: And the God that hath caused his name to dwell there destroy all kings and people, that shall put to their hand to alter and to destroy this house of God which is at Jerusalem. I Darius have made a decree; let it be done with speed.
verses.ct: May the God who has established his name there overthrow any king or people who attempts to change this decree or to destroy this house of God in Jerusalem. I, Darius, have issued this order. Let it be carried out promptly."

verses.kjv: Then Tatnai, governor on this side the river, Shetharboznai, and their companions, according to that which Darius the king had sent, so they did speedily.
verses.ct: Tatnai, the governor of the region west of the Euphrates, Shetharboznai, and their associates carried out exactly what King Darius had commanded, and they did so without delay.

verses.kjv: And the elders of the Jews builded, and they prospered through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo. And they builded, and finished it, according to the commandment of the God of Israel, and according to the commandment of Cyrus, and Darius, and Artaxerxes king of Persia.
verses.ct: The Jewish elders continued building and making progress, encouraged by the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah son of Iddo. They built and completed the temple in obedience to the command of the God of Israel and the decrees of Cyrus, Darius, and Artaxerxes king of Persia.

verses.kjv: And this house was finished on the third day of the month Adar, which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.
verses.ct: The temple was completed on the 3rd day of the month of Adar, during the 6th year of King Darius's reign.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel, the priests, and the Levites, and the rest of the children of the captivity, kept the dedication of this house of God with joy,
verses.ct: The people of Israel — the priests, the Levites, and the rest of those who had returned from exile — celebrated the dedication of this house of God with great joy.

verses.kjv: And offered at the dedication of this house of God an hundred bullocks, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs; and for a sin offering for all Israel, twelve he goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
verses.ct: For the dedication of this house of God, they offered 100 bulls, 200 rams, and 400 lambs. As a sin offering for all of Israel, they presented 12 male goats, one for each tribe of Israel.

verses.kjv: And they set the priests in their divisions, and the Levites in their courses, for the service of God, which is at Jerusalem; as it is written in the book of Moses.
verses.ct: They organized the priests into their divisions and the Levites into their groups for the service of God in Jerusalem, just as it is prescribed in the book of Moses.

verses.kjv: And the children of the captivity kept the passover upon the fourteenth day of the first month.
verses.ct: On the 14th day of the 1st month, those who had returned from exile celebrated the Passover.

verses.kjv: For the priests and the Levites were purified together, all of them were pure, and killed the passover for all the children of the captivity, and for their brethren the priests, and for themselves.
verses.ct: The priests and Levites had all purified themselves together — every one of them was ceremonially clean — and they slaughtered the Passover lamb for all the exiles, for their fellow priests, and for themselves.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel, which were come again out of captivity, and all such as had separated themselves unto them from the filthiness of the heathen of the land, to seek the LORD God of Israel, did eat,
verses.ct: The Israelites who had returned from exile ate the Passover meal, along with everyone who had separated themselves from the unclean practices of the surrounding nations in order to seek the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: And kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with joy: for the LORD had made them joyful, and turned the heart of the king of Assyria unto them, to strengthen their hands in the work of the house of God, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: They celebrated the Festival of Unleavened Bread for 7 days with great joy, because the LORD had filled them with happiness and had turned the heart of the king of Assyria in their favor, giving them support in the work on the house of God, the God of Israel.
